page.title: 07Local History
page.content: The church in Presteigne,which is named{St.Andrew's,}dates back to{Saxon times and although it is in Powys it is part of the Hereford dioscese.There is one interesting new{gravestone}in the churchyard as the original has been placed in the church.It belongs to Mary Morgan who was a{domestic {servant at Newcastle Court.}On the 11th of April 1805 she was tried for murdering her new born baby.It is said that the baby's father was on the jury that found her guilty. A man at the trial was disgusted by the verdict and rode to London and back, bringing with him a reprieve, but when he reached Presteigne she had already been hung.She was originally buried in unconsecrated ground but the land now belongs to the church.
